Description:
Lifestyle Opportunities Abound!
This is the life! A spacious family home offers extensive views of the local area and bay complete with huge elevated outdoor entertainment area and in-ground solar heated pool. Set on a fantastic allotment of approximately 1121m2 with ample room to store the boat, caravan and all the family's toys. The home offers spacious lounge & dining, new central kitchen with quality appliances plus 3 generously sized bedrooms and central bathroom. Downstairs there is also a separate studio or perhaps a room for the teenagers of the home to escape to. Reverse cycle air conditioners, central gas heating, double carport, 4 water tanks, solar panels, awnings, a second shower & WC for pool users, side access- the list goes on. Call us to arrange a time to view.
Insights: 40-42 Dandarriga Drive, CLIFTON SPRINGS VIC 3222 was last sold in 2017 and 109 other 3 bedroom house in CLIFTON SPRINGS have recently been sold.

Description:
CA9 - 1408sqm Township block
Generous sized parcel of land at 1408sqm with a lovely wide frontage of 28 metres facing East on Canterbury St. Build the family home and enjoy the surrounding views.
Less than 400m to the Primary School, and a short 900m stroll to township centre.
Power, water, and sewer are passing and available for connection. Zoned Township.
Offered separately or discuss opportunity to buy both CA9 and CA10 together.
Clunes is a historic Central Victorian township, and popular destination within 2hrs of Melbourne. Less than 30 minutes to Ballarat & Maryborough and approx. 40 minutes to Daylesford. Rich in diversity and community spirit, you dont just buy property in Clunes, you are welcomed into the community family.
Contact Angela Flowers for further information and to arrange your inspection on 0437 456 908

Description:
Unique Art Deco Home On Two Titles
Dating back to the 1920s, this classic Art Deco home 'Somerglen' is ready to love!
Like one of the period homes from hit renovating show 'The Block' - this comfortable two-bedroom period home could be transformed into an absolute beauty.
Whether you redecorate this century old Californian bungalow with modern aesthetics or keep the original character from years gone by, this property has the ideal bones to do as you please and also comes complete with its own library of books.
A classic decorated front veranda, timber floors, ceiling roses, picture rails, wood heating, gas heating, a country style dine-in kitchen with Rayburn cooker and gas stove along with an original laundry are some of the unique features indoors, while outdoors provides an eclectic spread of infrastructure, with approx. 3,043m2 and the opportunity to subdivide with gated access from Talbot Road or West Street with two individual titles.
This delightful bungalow sits to one side of the land with a magnificent Hakea Laurina tree, while the other side is virtually clear to tackle something completely different just moments from the historic township of Clunes.
Finished with a full width fence and further mature trees, this corner property provides an amazing opportunity for those with a little imagination or investor know how.
Insights: 43 Talbot Road, Clunes VIC 3370 was last sold in 2020 and 7 other 2 bedroom house in Clunes have recently been sold.

Description:
Immaculate centrally located light filled home
Centrally located in a tightly-held area, this opportunity is not to be missed. Built in the 1940s by a well-regarded local builder, this double fronted home has been lovingly refurbished over the past decade by the current owner keeping true to the era of mid-century Art Deco with some very special and exceptional inclusions. Original polished Baltic pine floorboards, picture rails and glass panelled doors provide continuity of architectural aesthetic throughout.
Upon entering, the foyer is wide and welcoming. Two of the 4 bedrooms are located in the front portion of the home. These rooms are both of generous proportions, second bedroom is the ideal home office or library; both front bedrooms have additional TV points.
Bathroom fittings include a unique Shanks nickel-plated brass shower screen sourced from a stately Toorak home and installed over the bath. The vanity and accompanying overhead cupboard are both original to the period and provide ample bathroom storage.
The easterly facing lounge has lovely sash corner windows for morning sun, and on winters days is warmed by a gas flame log heater set over drip-glaze mid-century hearth tiles sourced from a Bulleen mansion.
Flowing on through, the kitchen/dining area leads to the additional two bedrooms. Bedroom 3 has original timber panelling and incorporates a second gas log heater; this versatile space would make a charming formal breakfast room. Bedroom 4 overlooks the undercover area and would make an ideal office or sewing room with plenty of afternoon sunlight. The original stove cavity has been repurposed in the dining area to host a solid fuel heater surrounded by curved Art Deco style cabinetry inspired by English Country kitchens, with Blackwood mantelpiece and custom-designed brushed steel hearth.
Spacious dining area with feature wall lighting, amply accommodates seating for up to 12 persons. Kitchen refurbishment includes a Smeg Victoria stove with gas cooktop and electric ovens, custom Blackwood benchtops, Miele dishwasher with a fabulous behind sink window allowing plentiful natural light. Flooring throughout the kitchen, abundantly light filled breakfast area in the north-west corner and second bathroom/laundry is imported European Marmoleum, a natural product with coved edges providing an easy to clean and fabulous flooring surface.
Step outside through either of the full-length sliding doors to the back deck and west-facing undercover sitting area - the ideal afternoon retreat. Raised garden beds line the boundary, and a handy outdoor trough is conveniently placed for clean up after enjoying time in the garden. Ample off street parking alongside the home, plus good sized garage/workshop with storage alcove. All this on an elevated compact block of 498sqm, located less than 600 metres to the town centre, 700 metres to the train station.
Features Include:
4 bedrooms
2 bathrooms
LPG flame log heaters
Solid fuel heater
Smeg 900m gas/electric stove
Miele dishwasher
Electric hot water
Blackwood benchtops
Unique pieces throughout
Low maintenance 498sqm parcel of land
With its rich gold mining history and set in a vibrant arts and cultural region, Clunes is an historic Central Victorian township and popular destination well-known as a favoured film location. Within 1.5 hours of Melbourne, less than 30 minutes drive to Ballarat and in easy reach of Maryborough, Daylesford and neighbouring Creswick, Clunes is a thriving town rich in diversity and community spirit and a wonderful place to call home.
Inspection by appointment, please phone Angela Flowers on 0437 456 908

Description:
An Abundance of Charisma
Set on approx. 4 acres and only minutes from the heart of Clunes, this 3 bedroom family home oozes country charm. From the quaint spacious kitchen complete with walk in pantry, gingham cupboard covers and the locally sourced breakfast bar timber, to the built-in bar waiting for the next gathering of friends and family, this much-loved family home has an abundance of charisma.
With a large spacious bathroom, plus second shower room, there is a space for multiple members of the house to get ready at the same time. The North Easterly master bedroom boasts elevated views over Cameron Reserve, Creswick Creek plus Clunes Common. Step outside and add to the enjoyment with the surrounding vista to include Esmond Park, incorporating the site of the Port Phillip Mine, on which Clunes was founded. Established gardens, which include a mixture of native & roses, plus fruit trees incorporating quince and lemon with the addition of a small grape vine section. Workshop shedding plus a bungalow for the extra guests, there is something for everyone at this property. Inspection is a must to appreciate all on offer.
Features Include:
Charming country kitchen
Timber flooring in living area
Built in bar
Solid fuel heater
X2 reverse cycle split systems
Sunken lounge
Elevated position
Workshop
Bungalow
Lpg gas cooking
Single garage
3 bedrooms with bamboo flooring
Main bathroom, shower over bath, vanity & toilet
Second bathroom shower & vanity

VACANT LAND WITH PANORAMIC VIEWS
This elevated block of land is set high and offers wonderful views, it has the extra space you've been looking for while still being close to cafes & shopping district in the centre of town. Measuring 0.89 Hectares the land is over 8,900m2 or just above 2 acres. Build your dream home on this attractive block. This property will be highly sort after due to its location and historic setting.
Features:
Planning permit issued
Just 15 minutes to Creswick, 30 minutes to Ballarat and 90 minutes to Melbourne
Clunes Township is well known for its antiques, collectables and fine art stores
Services available - Mains water and Power
An onsite inspection is highly recommended as advertised or by private appointment.

Description:
"The Edge Retreat"
A shining example of architecture, this stately home built over three levels, has been meticulously designed and re-energised to maximise light and draw the panoramic views that envelop the home indoors.
Beyond its striking façade, a beautifully considered layout includes multiple bedrooms, two stunning living zones with breathtaking views over the valley and creek, and a light filled kitchen with an accomplished list of quality extras.
Soaring ceilings, Baltic pine floors and huge seamless windows are the focus on entering this home, while an extended flue combustion fire, gas central heating plus a split system create real comfort through the ever-changing seasons.
The home has been set up with two accommodation units, which entertains surplus income, with three large wood fired pits, numerous verandas with sensational views and an outside spa and massage room facilities for guests. Low maintenance gardens feature extensive earth walling for terraced hillside views, while its sheer land size (approx. 1.01 hectares) and proximity to the historic township of Clunes is also a massive drawcard.
Full gravel apron, accessible all-weather road with a private walking track from the property are some of its unique features. Call our agent today to arrange a private inspection.

Description:
Hillcrest House
Landscaped and terraced formal gardens set the stage for a world class residence blending a late 1800s Victorian bluestone home with contemporary architecture. Hillcrest House is a sprawling estate with views of historic Clunes village in Central Victoria. One of Victorias most renowned and stylish country homes, Hillcrest House has been restored to showcase its stunning history together with a stylish blend of contemporary upgrades.
Crafted to the highest international standards, this superb residence provides an irreplaceable setting of rare sophistication and exclusivity. With Stuart Rattle inspired interiors, this immaculate home exudes warmth and a relaxed living style.
The perfect balance of formal, casual and entertainment areas are achieved from the floor plan flowing throughout both the historic and new sections of the home. The handsome, late Victorian bluestone wing of generous proportions features wide, sweeping verandas, and a stunning guest wing comprising 2 king size bedrooms, an expansive lounge with open fire place, kitchenette and luxurious shared bathroom. This area is ideal for family and/or guests, as a separate apartment with its own entrance.
Downstairs, the main bedroom suite has a fabulous walk-through robe and an en-suite with freestanding stone bath. The new and double glazed part of the home is luxurious, functional and seamlessly integrated. The bespoke kitchen and butlers pantry combine Carrara marble with country style painted cabinetry and elite appliances including 2 Aga ovens.
The living room showcases an open fireplace with hand carved timber surround, antique light fittings and French doors opening to the garden. A home office, fourth bedroom with en-suite and large laundry with ample storage and external access complete the home.
The residence is well-appointed with every conceivable luxury including zoned hydronic floor heating to the entire ground floor, Carrara marble flooring and walls to en-suite and bathrooms, Italian stone floor tiles, imported window furnishings and pure wool carpets. Hand blown glass light fittings showcase seamlessly with a collection of antique European pendants. Externally over 13,000 recycled Hawthorn blue bricks were sourced for the new extension, recycled timbers from Port Melbourne Pier formed the pergola and the wrought iron gates were imported from France.
There is a 5-car garage (including 2 car stackers), large store room, security monitoring, TV and CAT 5 cabling to most rooms, NBN connection, solar panels with battery storage and bore water supply. The tiered, landscaped gardens fed by an automated watering system are an absolute joy. Sit under the expansive wisteria covered pergola for summer entertaining and enjoy the fruit garden with quince, peaches, plums, nectarines, lemons, limes, oranges and apples, vegetable beds, a daffodil walk, the pond lawn and weaving hedge.
Hillcrest House is located only 1.5 hours drive from Melbourne and less than 30 minutes to Daylesford, Ballarat and Creswick. The historic village of Clunes has a proud gold mining history and boasts an original and charming streetscape, the scene of many movies and TV series.
Please visit www.hillcrestclunes.com.au for further information.
As directed by the REIV, the following guidelines apply to any person(s) entering a property for an inspection:
Anyone living in Stage 4 lockdown areas are currently unable to attend and inspect our properties.
For those living in Stage 3 areas, please contact the Sales Agent to make a private appointment to inspect the property. We ask that you respect the following guidelines:
Provide your name and contact information upon entry
Observe social distancing guidelines
Obey instructions from the Estate Agency representatives; and
Not touch surfaces or door handles without direct supervision by the Estate Agency representatives
** We have obtained all information in this document from sources we believe to be reliable, however, we cannot guarantee its accuracy. Prospective purchasers are advised to carry out their own investigations.

Description:
Enjoy the lifestyle.
Positioned well back on the block for privacy this small acreage property offers the astute purchaser many opportunities. North facing double brick single bedroom home, features a solid fuel heater, split system, and even a spa bath. A 6x6m self-contained grannie flat adds versatility. Plus, a large undercover outdoor entertaining area connects the two.
Set on approximately 11,575sqm, (2.8 acres or 1.15ha) the property has ample shedding including; 7.4x5.8 powered garage with concrete floor & wood heater, also a lined and insulated office/studio with small sink & own hws with wall heater & air conditioner, a hayshed, c/van port, and a solid chook yard. Well set up for the ponies divided into 3 paddocks, one with stable, a tack room & round yard.
All this less than 5 minutes from Clunes township centre.
Clunes is a historic Central Victorian township, and popular destination within 2hrs of Melbourne. Less than 30 minutes to Ballarat & Maryborough and approx. 40 minutes to Daylesford. Rich in diversity and community spirit, you dont just buy property in Clunes, you are welcomed into the community family.

Description:
Character Space And Timeless Elegance Set On 6.5 Acres
This magnificent Kit Set home on approx. 6.5 acres, showcases incomparable luxury, graceful elegance, and exceptional family versatility.
Neat as a pin with a red brick paved driveway and double lock up garage, this timeless beauty offers gleaming hardwood floors, two free standing wood heaters one with a bakers oven, split systems, 4 bedrooms, 3 with built in robes and large master walk in robe with ensuite , multiple living areas and solar hot water. While further features include granite benches, claw foot bath, a large corner spa bath, dishwasher drawer, ADSL internet and mains power and so much more. Sliding doors open to a fully decked alfresco space with roll down clears & blinds, stunning open garden vistas and glimpses of Mt Beckworth beyond.
Further to the outside, there is a 20x40 shed with 5kWs of solar energy, town water plus four big fresh water tanks along with fenced dog runs & kennels, shipping container, chicken coop, fruit trees, a vegetable patch, stunning gum trees, a dam, established trees and well fenced paddocks for small or large animals.
You'll be hard-pressed to find anything as peaceful, private and beautiful as this majestic home within moments of the historic township of Clunes, with a short trip through to Creswick, Ballarat or Melbourne via the Western Freeway.
Call our agent for a private inspection.

Description:
POTENTIAL PLUS PROPERTY IN PRIVATE CLUNES LOCATION
Ideally locate walking distance to central Clunes and shops is this simple and comfortable residence. The home boasts 3 bedrooms each with BIR's, an open plan kitchen/meals area with good cupboard space, helpful food prep and serving area serviced by electric cooking. Other features include bathroom with shower over bath with large mirror, private toilet, A/C system, aluminum windows plus front and rear verandah areas. Externally on the impressive approx. 1530sqm block is a carport and 9.2mx6.2m shed. The vendor at his own expense has been granted approval by council to subdivide the block if you so choose to with 2 parcels of land (318sqm and 342sqm) ready for townhouses. With this property having multiple offerings here be first to inquire today.

Description:
Build Your Dream Home With Picturesque Views And Existing Planning Permit!
With sweeping views towards Mount Beckworth and the prospects of a peaceful country life, this block could be the one for you!
Measuring approx. 6.43HA (15.88 acres), the block offers one of the best views in the Clunes district.
All of the hard work has been done with an existing approved planning permit in place, bushfire management report available, farm management plan available all you need to do is start your build!
The property is divided into 3 paddocks. The 2 paddocks at the top of the hill offer improved pastures, rich volcanic soil and the front paddock would be the ideal home site.
A brand new bore has been installed guaranteeing water for stock, the property is fully fenced and a new gravel driveway has been installed.
A short drive will have you in Clunes, Learmonth or Ballarat meaning the country life is possible without being too far from modern conveniences.
Power is available at the front of the property for connection to your home.
A rare opportunity to secure a picturesque property in a tightly held location.
For more information contact Matt on 0401 728 881 of Jacqui on 0411 065 339.

Description:
Prime Clunes Property in the Main Street.
* Great character, great history and options galore in the main street of the historical Clunes Township.
* Lovingly completed internal restoration and renovations have this property ready for your chosen use.
* B1Z- Commercial 1 Zone in the Hepburn Shire Council - Hepburn Planning Scheme. Commercial or residential usages are applicable.
* Floorplan showcases a showroom, living room, kitchen, bedroom with ensuite and alfresco living area.
* Floorplan continues on to an adjoining kitchen, bathroom, large upstairs mezzanine and former stable area.
* Two street frontage is a key bonus. Land size of 188m2. Love the early shopfront. Love the integrity.
* Clunes is 36km north of Ballarat, 19kms to Creswick and 40kms to Daylesford.
* Since 2007 Clunes has hosted its Booktown event and now has International Booktown status.
* Since 2000 Wesley College has established a Year 9 campus at Clunes.
* Parts of the feature film Ned Kelly and more recently Bloom were filmed in Clunes.
*Inspections available. Please call Phil Petrie now to arrange your personal inspection.

Description:
Light Filled Family home
Sharing a boundary with Esmond Reserve, enjoy uninterrupted views across to Scenic Drive Clunes from your back yard. The home offers 3 generous sized bedrooms and modern bathroom. Updated kitchen and ample dining area, opens through to a spacious lounge with both solid fuel heater and reverse cycle split system.
Outside, sit back and relax on the expansive alfresco/outdoor entertaining area, with extended deck/fernery which steps down onto the lush grassed back lawn. Plenty of off-street parking and copious shedding space with two well-appointed garage/storage/workshop options on the approx. 1100sqm property.
Only 750m to the Primary school and 1100 m to Clunes CBD.
Make Clunes your home, a delightful rural community less than 30 minutes to Ballarat & Maryborough, and under 2 hours from Melbourne.
Features Include:
Easy care garden and lawn
Established native garden
9x6.8m garage built 2018/power/concrete flooring/mezzanine storage/H&C water/electric roller door
6x5m storage shed/garage/tilt door
5000lt tank & pump
3 Bedrooms
Wood heater & split system
Alfresco area
LPG cooking
Electric HWS
Town Water

Description:
Live the Dream
Dreaming of a rural retreat? Make it a reality on this attractive and flat parcel of land on the fringe of Clunes township.
The hard work has been done, fencing, planning, services, all ready to go.
Take advantage of the exceptional architectural concept design already rendered for this picturesque block maximising the valley views to the North East, and iconic Mount Beckworth to the West.
It is a rare opportunity to acquire land in a highly sort after Court location with sweeping views.
Contract your builder, sell where you live and get ready to enjoy the relaxed country lifestyle.
· 7701sq.m approx. 1.9 acres - .77ha
· Court location
· Zoned Low Density Residential
· Planning permit
· Services to the block
· Architectural render
· Floor plan capturing views and Northern Light
· Elevation drawings of 4 Bedroom home
- Large building envelope for flexibility on where you place your new home
Clunes is a historic Central Victorian township, and popular destination within 2hrs of Melbourne. Less than 30 minutes to Ballarat & Maryborough and approx. 40 minutes to Daylesford. Rich in diversity and community spirit, you dont just buy property in Clunes, you are welcomed into the community family.

Description:
Business for sale
Phone inquiry ID: 80710
The Edge Retreat, beautiful Architectural Designed Home grounds restored, updated and the height of luxury living in an old-world charm town seeped in history, the only surviving "First nation sensitive block of residential land" of the gold era in Clunes Victoria.
Step back into another time, walk the private trail exclusively used for The Edge Retreat to Creswick Creek, a few steps and you enter four unique accommodation units, overlooking the picturesque rural views. Surrounded by the terraced gardens the home opens showcasing the features of the landscape, with quality wide Baltic pine flooring, super high ceilings, large spacious rooms tastefully decorated to the design. The entrance and hallway encapsulate the light and space. The lounge welcomes any guest with crisp white walls, luxurious textured fabrics bringing the eye to the central fireplace, cosy up reading, sipping a fine wine.
Photos not doing justice to the exquisite view or space of the four-roomed house, kitchen and dining is bright, modernised appliances, cabinetry, three large wood-fired outdoor pits to bake delicious dampers, stews, the perfect place morning and afternoon to take in the sun, watch the active bird life or admire the gardens. The third bedroom, studio or guest space has a full bathroom,(shower), and powder tiny home/guest balcony, again all beautifully appointed with additions and quality fixtures.
Outside the back veranda the owners have created a relaxed space to sunbath, for casual entertaining, reading. This space is perfect to entertain with outside spa and massage room facilities, stay the weekend invite the family and friends, you will never want to leave.
A low maintenance garden featuring extensive earth walling, many different "rooms" terraced on the hillside. Stunning all year round but perfect during spring and autumn, the garden can be enjoyed from multiple veranda's facing north, south, and east, affording views over Creswick Creek valley.
Fully gravel apron, accessible all- weather road to the property, with an additional walking track from the Edge Retreat entry.
Features include
* Situated above the township of Clunes over 10100m2(Approx) area
* Two Front Bedrooms with a third large bedroom and extra bedroom/Study.
* Stunning kitchen/dining area which has featured in magazines and an outdoor closed in verandah area for summer.
* Solid Fuel heater in lounge, instant gas hot water with gas central heating and split system backup- enables the whole house to be cosy warm no matter what the weather.
* Terraced gardens complete with earth walling creating different "view advantages".
* Fully renovated home devived into two accommodation units
* A stunning array of birds throughout the garden.
* Stunning views over Creswick Creek Valley.
* Short walk down Clunes Township and Showgrounds.
An ideal weekend retreat, accommodation facility, permanent home or studio/gallery
Accommodation website
www.theedgeretreat,com
Also can be found on tripadviser, airbnb, stayz, homeaway, adgo, trivago, expedia and https://www.facebook.com/alternitivehealth.com.au

Description:
Premium Country Retreat On 5 Acres
Boasting high-end finishes and a sense of luxury at every turn, this 40 square brick veneer home with a wide circular driveway sits on the fringe of the picturesque township of Clunes.
Clunes and its surrounding district is brimming with vintage stores, vineyards, wineries and magnificent scenic walks, while its history-rich township is situated halfway between Ballarat and Maryborough in Hepburn Shire, with approx 90 minutes drive through to Melbourne.
With a balanced mix of open spaces and native trees, this property of approx 5 acres is well established with town water, tank water, a garden shed and an extensively paved outdoor area; perfect to entertain outdoors.
An elegant full width veranda welcomes a sophisticated four bedroom home soaked in natural light, with a soothing outlook including uninterrupted distant views over the vast property.
With three capacious living rooms including a massive games room with direct access outdoors, this home also boasts two bathrooms, built in and walk in robes, a fully fitted study and an oversized kitchen with stainless steel appliances including a 900mm cooker and range hood. Comforted by; central heating, two split systems and a freestanding combustion heater along with the added bonus of 3kWs of solar efficiency to reduce your running costs.

Description:
Become a custodian of Victorian Goldfields history with this once in a lifetime opportunity being the Clunes Post Office building (circa 1879)
Set across 1147sqm is this impressive property which would be one of the most prominent buildings of its era in the township of Clunes.
The Clunes Post and Telegraph Office was built in 1879 to a design by the Public Works Department. The principal building was constructed by Messrs Lewis and Roberts at a cost of £4099 and the kitchen outbuildings were constructed by Charles Morgan & Co for an additional £279. The building replaced an earlier and smaller post office built in 1861. That the current building is so much bigger and grander than its predecessor is indicative of the township's rapid expansion and peaking of population in the 1870s as a result of both the deep-lead mining and the coming of the railway in 1874.
The building is designed in an Italian Renaissance "palazzo" style, is of two storeys, and is constructed of rendered brick with a slate roof. The ground floor post and telegraph office is entered via a recessed arcaded loggia with the entrance to the post-master's residence on the first floor via a lobby to the side of the building.
The building is of significance as a well-executed and preserved example of public Renaissance Revival design, as an indication of the prosperity of the developed Clunes goldfields (the area of first gold strike in Victoria) and as a key element within the historic townscape of Clunes.'
The most recent use of the building has been for a residence and library which has been opened regularly to the public and is a popular attraction during the famed annual Booktown Festival in Clunes.
The building offers a variety of possibilities and uses with approx. 5 bedrooms, multiple living areas, country style kitchen, large library area, study space, huge hallways, an original timber staircase, impressive cornices and finishings and feature fireplaces.
The property lends itself to further improvement and could be ideal for a business, residence, bed and breakfast or to renovate/restore then on sell.
Situated just a short stroll from shops, cafes, churches, school, only 30 mins to Ballarat and 1 hour 40 mins to Melbourne.
Opportunities such as this are rare and this property is sure to attract national attention so be sure to book your inspection ASAP.
For sale by Tender with offers to be submitted in the form of a Contract of Sale.
